resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a capuccino cup

Espresso with added hot water (100–150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the cofee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150–300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.
A double ristretto topped with velvety milk, served in a smaller cup (usually 150 ml). Stronger than a flat white, smoother than an espresso.
A ristretto shot topped with warm, silky milk in a small glass (around 90 ml). Think of it as a mini latte with a bolder espresso punch.
Espresso \'stained\' with a small amount of milk or milk foam. Served in a demitasse cup. Strong, simple, and to the point.
